means: 使免罪，免除( exonerate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The official report basically exonerated everyone.
sentence.Network_cn: 官方报道基本上宣布所有人无罪。

sentence.Network_en: The police report exonerated Lewis from all charges of corruption.
sentence.Network_cn: 警方的报告免除了对刘易斯贪污的所有指控。

sentence.Network_en: An investigation exonerated the school from any blame.
sentence.Network_cn: 一项调查证明该学校没有任何过失。

PerfectNetExp.abs: And even though the defendant was exonerated , he ultimately victimized by the charges ., 即使被告被宣告没有过失 , 他最终还是因诉讼受到了损害.
distraught 心神错乱的exonerated 免罪的inspired 雄心壮志的
And even though the defendant was exonerated , he was ultimately victimized by the charges ., 况且 , 即使被告被宣告无罪 , 他最终仍因为这些指控而受到伤害.

list.abs: In the end Audi exonerated from any wrong doing , however the damage had been done ., 最终奥迪被免除任何错误做 , 但损害已经完成.
可证明无罪的情况 exonerating circumstances  的相关例句  1. Our circumstances have been rather exceptional.我们的情况相当特别.来自《简明英汉词典》 2. We.
exculpate culpa 罪exonerate onerous 负有法律责任的Jiangang 发表于2006-09-14 08:22:35 | 阅读全文 | | 编辑 |
...罗宾·莱特·潘robin right penn马克·鲁法罗马克 ruffalo地域:美国语言:英语《被证无罪》(the exonerated)中福建省教育厅电话文名称:被证无罪英文名称:the exonerated资源类型:dvdrip刊.

entry.tran: 使免于罪责;证明…无罪;宣布…无罪
entry.def: If a court, report, or person in authority exonerates someone, they officially say or show that that person is not responsible for something wrong or unpleasant that has happened.

example.ex: The official report basically exonerated everyone...
example.tran: 官方报道基本上宣布所有人无罪。

example.ex: An investigation exonerated the school from any blame.
example.tran: 一项调查证明该学校没有任何过失。

means.word_mean: 1. freed from any question of guilt;

sentences.sentence: "was now clear of the charge of cowardice"

auth_sentence.content: We anticipate that he will be fully exonerated.
auth_sentence.res_content: We anticipate that he will be fully exonerated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We anticipate that he will be fully exonerated.

auth_sentence.content: He was exonerated, but the allegation of misconduct infuriated him.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was exonerated, but the allegation of misconduct infuriated him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was exonerated, but the allegation of misconduct infuriated him.

auth_sentence.content: It may turn out that all people involved may be exonerated.
auth_sentence.res_content: It may turn out that all people involved may be exonerated.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It may turn out that all people involved may be exonerated.
